meta.content: We are incredibly excited to begin our twentieth year here at King Center Charter School! This year marks a historical moment in the life of King Center Charter School. We will celebrate its...

a.font: Click here for King Center Covid-19 Response Info

div.span:
We are incredibly excited to begin our twentieth year here at King Center Charter School! This year marks a historical moment in the life of King Center Charter School. We will celebrate its pioneer status in Buffalo as the trailblazer for other charter schools, while being one of the oldest in New York State. This promises to be a year filled with phenomenal celebrations for our stakeholders who helped make this possible. As we embark on this journey, we pledge to our students, staff and parents, that this will be a year of engaging, meaningful and rigorous work in our classrooms, combined with special events and a plethora of extracurricular activities in honor of
​twenty years.

King Center Charter School partners with parents and the community to emphasize post-secondary preparation and planning for all of its students beginning at the earliest ages. KCCS seeks to create a caring, student-centered culture of high expectations for personal and academic excellence and accountability supported by evidence-based curriculum taught and supported by a deeply committed and highly qualified staff.

The road to college begins in kindergarten. The King Center purpose is to prepare all children for college and career success through a combination of academic rigor, student support service, and a caring community of peers and adults.

div.font:
The King Center Charter School is proud to partner with families and local community groups to prepare our students for success at the earliest ages.
King Center currently partners with the AmeriCorps ABLE program, The Arts in Education Institute, Buffalo State College, Canisius College, College Summit, Daemen College, Elmwood Franklin School, Hasek's Heroes, Houghton College, Niagara University, and the State University at Buffalo.
